snippet: Rebel fighters in the ancient crossroads of Timbuktu, Mali, announced the birth of a country called Azawad. But the declaration is unlikely to be embraced by anyone.
abstract: Memo from Africa; rebel fighters in ancient crossroads of Timbuktu, Mali, announce birth of country called Azawad, declaration that is unlikely to be embraced by anyone; Azawad refers to the areas where Tuaregs live in Mali, Niger and southern Algeria, and they base their claim to independence on the uniqueness of their lifestyle, language and history.
lead_paragraph: Rebel fighters in the ancient crossroads of Timbuktu, Mali, announced the birth of a country called Azawad. But the declaration is unlikely to be embraced by anyone.

headline.seo: Mali Rebels Declare Independence, but Face an Uphill Task
headline.main: For Rebels in Mali, Odds of Establishing a Nation Are Slim
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Mali Declare Their Independence, But Winning Recognition Is an Uphill Push

keywords.value: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
